body_html:
@ngimel well with the current implementation, trying to use dilated transposed convolution raises an error on CPU or on GPU when cudnn is disabled. But does something when cudnn is enabled.
In this particular case, the problem is that is raises an error that is hard to link to the problem and that is why I raise a meaningful error message (even in the case where using cudnn would have worked, but I'm not sure if it's a bug or a feature).

body:
@ngimel well with the current implementation, trying to use dilated transposed convolution raises an error on CPU or on GPU when cudnn is disabled. But does something when cudnn is enabled.
In this particular case, the problem is that is raises an error that is hard to link to the problem and that is why I raise a meaningful error message (even in the case where using cudnn would have worked, but I'm not sure if it's a bug or a feature).
